result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) .120. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) .120 was dismissed by the court.

  • Christopher C. Baumer was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Christopher C. Baumer was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with R.B. unless agent approves.

AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

Psychological assessment and comply with recommendations.

Domestic violence assessment and comply with recommendations.

Enroll in and successfully complete La Crosse Area Veterans Court.

No possession or consumption of any controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name and take prescribed medications exactly as directed to be taken.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

No possession or consumption of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
